Anthony Minghella spent five years mulling over ideas for how he might make an opera, thinking over which opera to choose and how to adapt the skills he used in The English Patient and Cold Mountain, for example, to the opera stage.

We approached this production with as much humility as we ought to have had in the sense the singers are working all the time and they're - to be standing on the Met stage means that they're at the top of an extremely competitive field, they're the best singers in the world.

It's not for us to, you know, revolutionize opera.
